sentences.en: Authors are famously ignorant about the realities of publishing.
sentences.cn: 作者们不了解出版界的实际情况，这是人所共知的。

sentences.en: He is utterly ignorant of staff [ stave ] .
sentences.cn: 他对 五线谱 一窍不通.

sentences.en: He was self-important, vain and ignorant.

sentences.cn: 他对现代科技一无所知。
他并不愚蠢, 只是无知.

sentences.en: I met some very ignorant people who called me all kinds of names.
sentences.cn: 我碰到了一些非常粗鲁的家伙，他们用各种脏话骂我。

sentences.en: I'm neither so young as you think nor so ignorant.
sentences.cn: 我既不象你想的那么年轻,也不那样无知.

sentences.en: I'm statistic-phobic, and hopelessly ignorant of medicine.
sentences.cn: 我对统计数据感到恐惧，对药物一窍不通。

sentences.en: It is precisely such ignorant people who take Marxism - Leninism as a religious dogma.
sentences.cn: 那些将 马克思列宁主义 当宗教教条看待的人,就是这种蒙昧无知的人.

sentences.en: Many people are worryingly ignorant of the facts about global warming.
sentences.cn: 许多人竟然不知道地球变暖的事实，实在令人担忧。

sentences.en: People don'tlike to ask questions for fear of appearing ignorant.
sentences.cn: 人们不喜欢问问题，害怕自己会显得很无知。

sentences.en: The intensely critical spirit is often the narrow - minded and ignorant one.
sentences.cn: 极爱吹毛求疵的人往往是心胸狭窄和无知的人.
他们无知到令人难以置信的地步.

sentences.en: We are still woefully ignorant of the causes of this disease.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是,我们仍对这种疾病的致病原因一无所知.

words.tran_cn: 不学无术的人；无知的人

trans.tran_cn: 无知的，愚昧的，由无知引起的，无学识的
trans.tran_en: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know
